TopicTitle: New forum for add-on releases for 1.2

Articles.Content:
Is it possible to start a new forum for add-on releases for version 1.2.  With all of the changes that are happening within 1.2, it would be nice to start fresh with a new forum.  It may be better to group mods into threads based on the release that they are for.  What does everyone think?

flintlockmusket

No. Didn't need one for previous versions with way more changes, and we'd have to search two threads for info for problems. Mods have their target core game version in the thread title, what more are you after?

Find it kind of funny that only one person posted an answer to my question, and went with the good old stand by of "didn't need it then, so why try it now" kind of response.  The reason I asked the question in the first place is because with all of the different versions of KSP, and with modders, some who either fell of the face of the earth, and some who don't place the version and date of the mod in the tag line, it is getting harder and takes more time to go through the list of released mods to find ones one might want to use.  Oh well.

I find it kind of funny, that if some don't even put the version and date in the tag line, that they would actually get around to creating a brand new thread in a separate forum.

Mods that are kept up to date naturally rise to page one, whether their tags are correct, due to posting activity.  Old mods with absent modders tend to fall many pages back due to lack of posting.

But instead with a new forum I would have to check both the new forum as well as the current one for all those modders who don't want to be bothered making a brand new thread.
